 Increase Subscription Price

Daily Voice
 Do Not Change Subscription Price
 <math alttext="$500 comma $400" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn><mo>,</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>$</mi><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$200 comma $700" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>200</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mi>$</mi> <mn>700</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

Increase Subscription Price
 <math alttext="$600 comma $300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>600</mn><mo>,</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>$</mi><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$300 comma $100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>300</mn><mo>,</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The two major newspapers in a city, Daily Voice and Town Herald, are considering whether to raise the subscription price. The first entries in the matrix above show the profits to Daily Voice, and the second entries show the profits to Town Herald.
content.question: Which of the following is consistent with the payoff matrix?

choices.label: Do Not Change Subscription Price is a dominant strategy for Daily Voice.
Do Not Change Subscription Price is a dominant strategy for Town Herald.
Increase Subscription Price is a dominant strategy for Daily Voice.
Increase Subscription Price is a dominant strategy for Town Herald.
There are no dominant strategies in the above payoff matrix.

content.answer: Increase Subscription Price is a dominant strategy for Daily Voice.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
